result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Lawrence Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 09-19-16. This includes the DV and DNA surcharge. Non-payment penalty is conversion into a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms

Court advises defendant that if he obtains employment he may contact the court to request Huber privileges

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Lawrence Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Lawrence Moore in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Steven Lawrence Moore in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 8  MONTHS  in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 97 days served; straight time.  

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 2  MONTHS  in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to the sentence imposed as to Count 1 with credit for Zero days served; straight time.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 09-19-2016. 
This includes the DV and DNA surcharge.  Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of costs, fees, assessments and surcharges is conversion into a civil judgment.  

Court advises defendant that if he obtains employment he may contact the court to request Huber privileges.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Steven Lawrence Moore in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Steven Lawrence Moore in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for fina pre-trial however, the parties have reached a resolution.

For reasons stated on the record, and on oral motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 to be added.  The Count 2 added is Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), and 973.055(1) a Class B Misdemeanor.

As to Count 1 and Count 2:   Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Court ordered the jury trial date of 09/09/2015 vacated.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED pending sentencing. Case adjourned to Branch 36 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Steven Lawrence Moore not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant NOT produced.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer K.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Steven Lawrence Moore in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Steven Lawrence Moore in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Lawrence Moore
Current: 2825 N. Holton Apt. #501, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 06-14-2015)
Prior: 2148 South 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
